poem:
Title: "Hidden Strength in Shadows"

In the city's concrete veins,
Queer hearts beat with resilience.
Seen not by the vast wealth's eyes,
But lens of the distant Dutch.
Hearts that knuckle a harsh, loveless Earth,
Sculpting survival from stone.
Strength blooms on ambiguous tracks,
Patient as the waiting moon.
Canvassed in light, finally seen,
Monuments of the unseen strength.
